content:
New from @binarly:
 
The process of infecting XZUtils with backdoor code is well documented.  This research is on the backdoor itself and provide in-depth analysis from both static and dynamic perspectives

https://t.co/roMk61hJSm

A fresh Palo Alto 0day being exploited in the wild 🐞 

Story at @SecurityWeek  https://t.co/cvDsnQNNDd

Hardware sold for years by the likes of Intel and Lenovo contains a remotely exploitable vulnerability that will never be fixed. 

https://t.co/9kz6RhWjrx <-- story by Dan Goodin @dangoodin001
Your weekly cybersecurity snapshot 🚒🚒 https://t.co/mpdGlPnp9n

US gov: "Midnight Blizzard’s successful compromise of Microsoft corporate email accounts and the exfiltration of correspondence between agencies and Microsoft presents a grave and unacceptable risk to agencies."

Story on CISA emergency directive @SecurityWeek…

🎧🔥 New pod advisory: I spent time with Cris Neckar on the early days of hacking at Neohapsis, time on the Google Chrome security team, shenanigans at Pwn2Own/Pwnium, the cat-and-mouse battle for browser exploit chains, and more...

LISTEN: https://t.co/45MXf8pHkZ
Timeline of an old, undocumented lighttpd vulnerability across the software supply chain https://t.co/PEFvvyL58c

How soon before these case studies are scrubbed?
https://t.co/fEEw5nRYXw

Subject line of a PR pitch in my inbox:

"Okta CEO interview on DHS security culture review of Microsoft"

Yes, that Okta 🙄
Microsoft Defender for IOT, critical, remote code execution.  Reported by Siemens 👇 https://t.co/Gz4UUyhZZx

ZDI blog:  " This is the largest Patch Tuesday release from Microsoft of all time."

https://t.co/GHcXhZEb3j

"An unauthenticated attacker can move the same workload onto a machine they control, where the attacker is root."

https://t.co/sviAjQkqge
A list of governments with Vulnerability Disclosure Policies, via ⁦CISA's @jackhcable⁩  https://t.co/MkDna8m854

🔥 NEW!  For your earholes this weekend: Costin Raiu joins the XZ backdoor investigation

Listen https://t.co/sDpY8IYlIU

Ivanti releases a carefully scripted YouTube video and an open letter from chief executive Jeff Abbott vowing to fix the entire security organization

Story @securityweek https://t.co/QKmb3xBSwg
Baseball in the the background during the day is the meaning of life.

The CSRB report is a remarkable document providing a blow-by-blow into one of the most daring APT attacks in history against a company [Microsoft] that somehow blew a decade’s worth of goodwill and completely lost its way in security

https://t.co/AHUWfsGhdL

We've reached the 'CEO Open Letter' part of Ivanti's security journey

I write about how pain has forced Ivanti to say they have found security enlightenment: 
https://t.co/QKmb3xBSwg

New from Mandiant:  Ivanti Connect Secure VPN post-exploitation lateral movement case studies
https://t.co/lSM98JJb1Y
I was correctly reminded yesterday that there's no such thing as "security culture"
https://t.co/R9n9MZ4UBF <-- now with an API for bulk scans, and VT results https://t.co/7QUL6bfi3p

Behind every CEO  letter promising to make security a priority are hundreds of overworked grunts keeping things operational and begging for support/resources to try to fix things.  I salute those folks 🫡
The "CEO Letter" part of the pain journey is always the most amusing

Shoutout to the CSRB for a very well written report on the Microsoft cloud hack.

To me, the only thing surprising about the findings is the deliberate harshness of the language used.

Gross 🤮

"Microsoft acknowledged to the [CSRB] in Nov 2023 that its Sep 6, 2023 blog post about the root cause was inaccurate, but did not update that post until March 12, 2024, as the Board was concluding its review and only after the Board’s repeated questioning about…
< 24 hours after the CSRB report, Microsoft PR in my inbox today hawking some Microsoft Defender unified SOC platform 🤯

The CSRB should have called for the firing of whoever came up with "AI-based cyber shield."

As much as I try, that one still stands out.

New Google report:

“If enabled, Lockdown Mode would have protected users from the majority of the exploitation chains discovered [in 2023] targeting iOS and attackers would not have been able to successfully compromise their targets.”

Story @SecurityWeek https://t.co/sGGJ9XjX8S
Clay Springs, Arizona 🌲 https://t.co/WJhCfv6wNA

SOHO router botnet, first seen in 2014, has been operating quietly while growing to more than 40,000 bots from 88 countries in January and February  of 2024
https://t.co/1PA6fXJ1P9
Fort Apache Reservation 🌲 https://t.co/8WXO5hkg4Z

Great line from the DOJ complaint:

"Apple users could use their iPod with a Windows computer, and Microsoft did not charge Apple a 30 percent fee for each song downloaded from Apple’s iTunes store."

Microsoft flags critical HyperV bug for urgent attention 

Patch Tuesday details at @SecurityWeek https://t.co/kqxRLWLoWm
It's pretty noticeable how ChatGPT is becoming less and less useful with each passing day.  Can't even count CVEs right :\

Google paid out $10 million via its bug bounty programs in 2023, bringing the total to nearly $60 million since 2010.

More at @SecurityWeek https://t.co/a7KR1JDEM8

I honestly thought the VPN would be dead by now
https://t.co/Jc7qdWOcqX

Microsoft says the Russian government-backed hacking team that broke into its corporate network and spied on senior executives also stole source code and may still be poking around its internal computer systems.

Story at @SecurityWeek https://t.co/aVOW78IHKs
Every now and then, I got to https://t.co/mRHDodN7pG to see what that page has become 😳

VMware ESXi sandbox escape bug so serious, even end-of-life installations get patches

Story at @SecurityWeek https://t.co/7zN8tlrkPw

Another take on the memory safety dance 👇

"But in a reality where even simply keeping track of your hardware and software assets is a formidable challenge for most enterprises, I think the push for 100% memory safety is a grievous misallocation of funds."…
Another week in cyber, via @SecurityWeek https://t.co/eigSMf1ey6

Microsoft is retroactively marking CVE-2024-21338 in the "already exploited" category.

They knew since Patch Tuesday that the North Koreans had live exploits 👇

SecurityWeek story by @EduardKovacs 
https://t.co/BpC4wfIZAh

White House report: 

"Software measurability is one of the hardest open research problems to address..."

https://t.co/WbQM47huhq

"In this article, we'll see how to put an entire car into a transportable box from scratch or at least the main electronic components."  cc @0xcharlie 

https://t.co/uZ6IDGCvfp

ConnectWise ScreenConnect 

- CVSS 10/10
- Remotely exploitable; high risk of exploitation

"Recommend installing updates as emergency changes or as soon as possible (e.g., within days)"

Story at @SecurityWeek https://t.co/uXR1oklODK

Heard a ton of good security people affected 😳
https://t.co/hv6kMnTKB4

Apple Vision Pro privacy principles
https://t.co/3FfTmH0MAU https://t.co/URA8I9B7FD
Weekend trending security headlines, via @SecurityWeek https://t.co/N7c88qOXqz

https://t.co/UPGuc9THKd

Microsoft threat hunters say foreign APTs are interacting with OpenAI’s ChatGPT to automate malicious vulnerability research, target reconnaissance and malware creation tasks.

Story at @securityweek 
https://t.co/sGieA1fWT1

Meta: "We recently enabled Control Flow Integrity (CFI) on Messenger for Android."

"We recently enabled a new memory allocator for the WhatsApp VoIP calling library. The allocator design includes numerous security properties that make exploitation of common memory safety…

Strategies for the Integration of Software Supply Chain Security in DevSecOps CI/CD Pipelines
https://t.co/tdaqpvbHNv

Zoom on Windows (critical, CVSS 9.6)
https://t.co/jdQi8sytWH
It's Patch Tuesday.  Be nice to the people in the packet mines.

NEW!  FortiOS exploitation in the wild 🔥

Fortinet warned organizations on Wednesday that APTs linked to China and other countries have been exploiting two known FortiOS vulnerabilities in attacks aimed at various sectors, including critical infrastructure.

Story by…

What on earth did I just look at?  These marketing spends are so bizarre
https://t.co/YJf035I1Wf

https://t.co/egtpA3zy0U
Clay Springs, Arizona 🌲 https://t.co/9zIQLur7EK

CISA: "As soon as possible and no later than 11:59PM on Friday February 2, 2024, disconnect all instances of Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure solution products from agency networks."

https://t.co/TnX7zFQyHh

The US government said it neutralized a botnet full of end-of-life Cisco and Netgear routers after confirming it was being used by a Chinese APT called Volt Typhoon.

Story at @securityweek https://t.co/YcgZ9Q881s

It's probably a good time to rethink the old Pulse Secure in your org ⚡️

Ivanti documents a brand-new zero-day and belatedly starts the slow rollout of patches; Mandiant is reporting “broad exploitation activity.”

The latest at @SecurityWeek 
https://t.co/R17o055IhQ

Ivanti is struggling to hit its own promised timeline for the delivery of patches for critical — and already exploited — vulnerabilities in Connect Secure VPN appliances (formerly Pulse Secure)

Story at @securityweek https://t.co/ebrQ1IRi09

Microsoft head of SOC and incident response
https://t.co/OB073kNSY3
Another hectic week in cyber, via @SecurityWeek https://t.co/S1NURUOCq1

Who are the others?

"Using the information gained from Microsoft’s investigation into Midnight Blizzard, Microsoft Threat Intelligence has identified that the same actor has been targeting other organizations and, as part of our usual notification processes, we have begun…

Bishop Fox security strategist Rob Ragan:

"There are so many companies and ideas that were ahead of their time. A lot of them should be revisited with the help of augmenting intelligence and the next phase of automation capabilities."  @sweepthatleg

LISTEN on Spotify
https://t.co/DORgptxWzm
So, Twitter turning off MFA led to two major account takeovers: Mandiant and the SEC.
So many experts on the Russians hacking Microsoft.  Make it stop, please.

Story at @SecurityWeek 
https://t.co/Z9kdEX4ddd

🔥 New podcast advisory: Katie Moussouris discusses @LutaSecurity's  new Workforce Platform profit-sharing initiative, the security job market, criticism of the CSRB’s lack of enforcement authority, and looming regulations around zero-day vulnerability data. @k8em0

A Russian government-backed hacking team broke into Microsoft’s corporate network and stole emails and attachments from senior executives.

BREAKING story at @securityweek
https://t.co/GWvDlqfYNg

https://t.co/hBc4cDhiNB <- episode sponsored by @binarly_io
Halfway through January, we've confirmed five (5) in the wild zero-day attacks (Chrome, Ivanti, Citrix)

Story at @SecurityWeek https://t.co/VPVLLNE96i

"The exploited zero-day, tagged as CVE-2024-0519, is described as an out-of-bounds memory access issue in the V8 JavaScript engine."

Remotely Exploitable ‘PixieFail’ Flaws Found in Tianocore EDK II PXE Implementation

Quarkslab finds serious, remotely exploitable vulnerabilities in EDK II, the de-facto open source reference implementation of the UEFI spec.

"How can AI or ML be used in a way to auto-assist or manage permissions in an IAM system?;  Or how can we use AI/ML better to prioritize queues in cybersecurity operations? @selenakyle https://t.co/KUUkokbTdS

On the pod, Allison Miller talks about innovation in identity and some raw realities:

"Every IAM implementation I've ever worked on has been sort of ugly. Deep in the infrastructure, you have to wire a lot of things in.  It requires a lot of work to get things up and running..." https://t.co/zxinyImMxO

https://t.co/rcswIcPdgh

Listen:
https://t.co/qDnSeMUnMk

"On October 13, 2023, BeyondTrust provided Okta Security a suspicious IP address attributed to the threat actor. With this indicator, we identified the additional file access events associated with the compromised account."

What the fuq is this gibberish:

"Microsoft invented the Security Development Lifecycle (SDL) and made it a bedrock principle of software trust and engineering. We will evolve it to “dynamic SDL” (dSDL)."

I swear, lawyers and PR people will write anything with a straight face.
